drift.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to move slowly on water or in the air
drift.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The rubber raft drifted out to sea.
Smoke drifted up from the jungle ahead of us.
drift.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to move, change, or do something without any plan or purpose
drift.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Idly she let her eyes drift over his desk.
Jenni spent the year drifting around Europe.
I just drifted into teaching, really.
The others drifted away. Melanie stayed.
The conversation drifted from one topic to another.
drift.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to gradually change from being in one condition, situation etc into another without realizing it
drift.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: He drifted in and out of consciousness.
She was just drifting into sleep when the alarm went off.
drift.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if values, prices, shares etc drift, they gradually change
drift.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The dollar drifted lower against the yen today.
drift.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if snow, sand etc drifts, the wind blows it into large piles
drift.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a large pile of snow or sand that has been blown by the wind
drift.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The road is blocked with massive drifts of snow.
drift.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a slow change or development from one situation, opinion etc to another
drift.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: a drift towards longer working hours
drift.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: a slow movement of large numbers of people that has not been planned
drift.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: the drift from the countryside to the cities
drift.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: the movement of a ship or plane from its original direction because of the movement of the wind or water
drift.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: very slow movement, especially over water or through the air
drift.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to go slowly up or down in value, without any particular direction
drift.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: London shares drifted in the absence of a statement from the Treasury.
The dollar drifted lower against other major currencies in thin trading.
The pound drifted down again yesterday.
The Nasdaq Composite Index drifted higher throughout the session to close with a gain of 1.27%.
drift.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: a slow change or development from one situtation, opinion etc to another
drift.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The drift towards recession started when the slump in the service sector became as bad as the slump in manufacturing.
